name: Love Creamed Spinach? This Kale Version Is Heartier and More Flavorful

ingredients.description: lacinato or curly kale (680 g; about 3 medium bunches), stemmed
plus 1 1/4 teaspoons (about 22 g) Diamond Crystal kosher salt, divided; for table salt, use half as much by volume
(43 g) finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese (about 1/4 cup)

instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of water and 2 tablespoons (18 g) kosher salt to a boil over high heat.
2. Add kale and cook, stirring occasionally, until vibrant green and tender, 6 to 7 minutes.
3. Using tongs or a spider strainer, transfer kale to a rimmed baking sheet, and let cool until cool enough to handle, about 15 minutes.
4. Working in batches, wrap kale in a clean kitchen towel, and squeeze to remove excess liquid.
5. Coarsely chop kale and set aside.

6. While kale cools, heat oil in a medium saucepan or high-sided skillet over medium heat.
7. Add shallot and cook, stirring often, until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
8. Add cream and bring to a simmer over medium heat, about 1 minute.
9. Cook, stirring frequently, until cream is thickened and reduced by about half, 8 to 10 minutes.
10. Reduce heat to low.
11. Add butter, garlic, and remaining 1 1/4 teaspoons (about 4 g) kosher salt.
12. Cook, stirring constantly, until butter is melted.
13. Add cream cheese and Parmesan.
14. Whisk until combined, about 2 minutes.
15. Stir in kale and cook, stirring occasionally, until warmed through and evenly coated in cream mixture, about 2 minutes.
16. If needed, gradually add up to 1/4 cup water to loosen mixture to desired consistency.
17. Remove from heat, and serve immediately.
notes: Creamed kale can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 4 days. Gently reheat on the stovetop or in the microwave, adding a little cream as needed to achieve the proper consistency.
